page.title: 13MANOR FARM,HANNINGTON
page.content: Manor Farm is owned by Captain Barker and since 1976 has been rented by Mr.Dibble who rents 1175 acres.He has 900 acres of cereal.He also has 275 acres of grass.The oats that they grow they sell and make porridge and they also grow wheat and barley.All together there are 47 fields.Captain Barker and Mr.Dibble are in partnership buying a corn dryer which is costing them Â£250,000.They have three tractors,a sheep trailer,a combine harvester,two cultivators and two ploughs.All the buildings on the farm are worth 2\ million pounds.In the last few years the farm has changed from keeping dairy cows to sheep.He has 2530 sheep.Mr.Dibble lives in a cottage on the farm where he enjoys his work.He has three dogs and four horses,three of which belong to children who rent the stables.
